Experience Web Solutions Engineer III Google June 2013  – Present (2 years 3 months) * Conceived idea for Chrome diagnostics app, created prototype of app, and wrote code for production version of application, which shipped with Chrome OS and Chromebox for Meetings. Also won approval for launch in the Chrome Web Store, where there are over 100K active users. Application has been featured in CNET, Lifehacker, OMG Chrome, Windows Club, and TechRepublic. 
 
* Wrote Android application using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) beacons for hyper locational-awareness. 
 
* Wrote Angular-JS based frontend for an HTTP-based application that serves as a wrapper on top of a query and monitoring system. 
 
* Setup and co-wrote Java-based HTTP backend for an HTTP-based application with the same framework that is used for the backend of Google Drive and Google Plus. 
 
* Wrote front-end for a web application to show off Google product solutions. Using advanced CSS3 techniques such as media queries and CSS3 pseudo-selectors to make website seamlessly scale to different form factors from small mobile phones to large desktop monitors. 
 
* Tech lead for Chrome App Builder, which provides a WYSIWYG interface for building simple kiosk Chrome Apps. The app has been positively reviewed in OMG Chrome and other news outlets. 
 
* Submitted over 900 code changelists to Google's production peer-reviewed repository in a single year. 
 
* Took the initiative to write an on-boarding and training plan for our new team members. Proceeded to mentor each new team member to expedite their onboarding. 
 
* Delivered multiple seminars on AngularJS to Software Engineers. 
 
* Delivered Tech Talk to the engineering organization on techniques to reduce web latency. 
 
* Earned Java and JavaScript readability to review Java and/or JavaScript code checked into Google's production repository. 
 
* Received 34 Peer Bonuses from colleagues during my time at Google for going above and beyond to assist them. Experience Web Solutions Engineer Google April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) Greater New York City Area Web Solutions Engineers deliver innovative solutions to help drive revenue and make Google's global sales field more efficient. As a Web Solutions Engineer, my responsibilities include prototyping proofs of concept, developing and supporting tools, and enhancing core products to meet the needs of Google's sales field. Custom Solutions Engineer Google January 2013  –  April 2013  (4 months) Milan Area, Italy As a Custom Solutions Engineer in EMEA within the Rich Media Innovation Services team, I'm responsible for developing innovative Flash and JavaScript components and server-side scripts on Google App Engine platform that push the envelope of technical possibility for client campaigns. I work closely with Engineers, Product Management and Account Managers while designing solutions to meet the broadest range of client needs possible. My role is extremely technical, end-user-focused and innovative, within a fast paced cross-functional team. Rich Media Technical Account Manager Google April 2011  –  January 2013  (1 year 10 months) Milan Area, Italy As a Rich Media Creative Technical Account Manager, I work with creative designers, database administrators and sales associates to conceptualize and execute ad banners. I support creative shops and advertisers on development strategy and enable them to incorporate advanced features such as tracking, video and audio and mobile capabilities into their display ads. I consult with clients about technical Flash questions that pertain to DoubleClick advertising campaigns. CTAMs are self-starting, innovative thinkers who love to interact with clients and love to code. Flash Architect Fullsix March 2008  –  March 2011  (3 years 1 month) Milan Area, Italy As a Flash Architect in Fullsix, I improved my skills in architecting and developing applications in Flash CS5 / Flex 4, with great focus on the use of frameworks (ie: PureMVC, Gaia Framework, Cairngorm) and design patterns (applied whenever possible to old-style AS2/Flash 8 projects too). I've been working on real time applications based on Red5 server, on both the definition of the architecture and implementation of the Java back-end. 
For research purpose and to drive innovation, I worked on some small development projects using Adobe BlazeDS data services and WebORB as alternative to LCDS for .NET platforms. 
Furthermore I was tech leader of Flash Platform developers. Flex / Flash Developer & RIA Specialist IconMedialab May 2003  –  March 2008  (4 years 11 months) Milan Area, Italy During my experience in IconMedialab as Flex & Flash Developer, I worked on different kind of projects: menu & navigation systems for CMS based web sites (XML data integration), financial computing tools, custom structural framework implementation (as development base for other apps), Flash RIAs Web Service based and Flex RIAs (both in Flex 1.5 and Flex 2). 
During those times, I had the chance to work with ASP.NET / SQLServer on tasks related to the management and generation of data structures to be integrated in Flash apps. 
In the late period as IconMedialab employee, I worked on a sound design project: definition of audio brand identity for a customer and creation of custom soundtracks for video presentations. Flash Developer - ASP Programmer Seven S.r.l. February 2001  –  May 2003  (2 years 4 months) Treviso Area, Italy While in Seven S.r.l. I worked on both front-end and back-end development. 
On the front-end side I improved my skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Flash/Actionscript. For a one year long period I developed video games in Flash 5 technology. On the back-end side I had the chance to work on both ASP and PHP technologies, SQLServer, MySQL and Flash Communication Server.
